title.narrative: Agricultural Market Access and Linkages for Smallholders in Makueni

description.narrative:
Agricultural development is crucial to Kenya’s overall economic and social development. The agriculture sector directly contributes about 26% of gross domestic product (GDP) and a further 27% through linkages with manufacturing, distribution and service-related sectors1. About 80% of the population lives in the rural areas and mainly depends on agriculture.
The sector accounts for 65% of Kenya’s total exports and provides more than 60% of informal employment in the rural areas. Therefore, the sector is not only the driver of Kenya’s economy, but also the means of livelihood for the majority of the Kenyan people.
Makueni County, covering an area of 8,034.7 km2, is one of the forty-seven counties in the country. In 2012 the projected population of the County was 922,183 consisting of 449,036 males and 473,147 females3.The main economic activities are subsistence agriculture, beekeeping, small-scale trade, livestock farming and commercial businesses. The agricultural enterprises comprise of fruits farming, limited coffee in Mbooni Hills, crop production (maize, cow peas, beans, pigeon peas, sorghum, green grams and horticulture) and livestock keeping.
The long-term objective is to develop the capacity of smallholder farmers in marketing agricultural commodities, mainly grains, use WFP's purchasing power to connect smallholder farmers to markets, and support the economic empowerment of women and men.
The immediate objective is to Enhance Smallholder grain farmers' access to the Home Grown School Meals Market and other structured markets.

Output 1 - Smallholder farmers receive support to increase capacity in structured marketing and post-harvest handling
Activity 1.1 - Identify six (6) Farmer Organizations (FO) and provide capacity building support to improve market access Activity 1.2 Trainings in market access and post-harvest handling skills for 2400 farmers Activity 1.3 Improve storage facilities for three FOs
Output 3 - Increased food sales by participating pro- smallholder aggregation systems to structured markets
Activity 3.1: Facilitate signing of contracts to supply food to schools under HGSMP for seven FOs and traders Activity 3.2 Facilitate signing of contracts to sell food to other structured markets Activity 3.3 Six FOs collectively sell 300 metric tons of cereals
